body:
**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.1", GitCommit:"82450d03cb057bab0950214ef122b67c83fb11df", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-12-14T00:57:05Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.1+coreos.0", GitCommit:"cc65f5321f9230bf9a3fa171155c1213d6e3480e", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-12-14T04:08:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:
Vagrant

- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
CoreOS

- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux c1 4.8.15-coreos #1 SMP Thu Jan 5 10:16:50 UTC 2017 x86_64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-5557U CPU @ 3.10GHz GenuineIntel GNU/Linux
```

- **Install tools**:
Vagrant & https://github.com/coreos/coreos-kubernetes/tree/master/multi-node/vagrant

- **Others**:


**What happened**:
```
error: error validating "examples/openshift-origin/etcd-discovery-controller.yaml": error validating data: [found invalid field triggers for v1.ReplicationControllerSpec, found invalid field strategy for v1.ReplicationControllerSpec, found invalid field capabilities for v1.Container, field replicas: is required]; if you choose to ignore these errors, turn validation off with --validate=false
```

**What you expected to happen**:
Success

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
Followed instructions at https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/examples/openshift-origin
Tried to run `kubectl create -f examples/openshift-origin/etcd-discovery-controller.yaml --namespace="openshift-origin"`
Received:
```
error: error validating "examples/openshift-origin/etcd-discovery-controller.yaml": error validating data: [found invalid field triggers for v1.ReplicationControllerSpec, found invalid field strategy for v1.ReplicationControllerSpec, found invalid field capabilities for v1.Container, field replicas: is required]; if you choose to ignore these errors, turn validation off with --validate=false
```

**Anything else do we need to know**:
From googling, it seems several of the fields in the config are for when using OpenShift origin. But creating the replication controller is a prerequisite to launching OpenShift Origin. Chicken & egg problem.
title: OpenShift Origin example does not work
